intro: Endlichera umbellata, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine regions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Endlichera umbellata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
